CONJUGATES: purples (noun plural) | purpler, purplest (adjective comparative/superlative) | purples, purpling, purpled (verb forms)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English `purpul` (noun) and `purpure` (adjective), from Latin `purpura` ('purple dye, purple-dyed cloth'), from Ancient Greek `porphyra` ('purple fish, purple dye').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Of a color intermediate between red and blue, typically one of the colors of the rainbow.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种介于红色和蓝色之间的颜色，通常是彩虹的颜色之一。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The flowers in the garden were a vibrant shade of purple.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 花园里的花是鲜艳的紫色。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: the color purple | a shade of purple
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A color intermediate between red and blue, typically one of the colors of the rainbow.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种介于红色和蓝色之间的颜色，通常是彩虹的颜色之一。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She chose purple for the walls of her bedroom.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她选择紫色来装饰她卧室的墙壁。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: wear the purple | elevated to the purple
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The color associated with royalty, imperial authority, or high ecclesiastical rank (such as a bishop or cardinal), often referring to the robes or insignia.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 与皇室、帝国权威或高级教职（如主教或枢机主教）相关的颜色，常指其长袍或徽章。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: In ancient Rome, only emperors were allowed to wear the royal purple.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在古罗马，只有皇帝才被允许穿戴皇家紫色。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: verb: a word used to describe an action, state, or occurrence
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make or become purple in color.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: As the fruit ripened, it began to purple on the vine.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 随着水果成熟，它在藤蔓上开始发紫。
